remarks: Cauchy's theorem for the order of an element in a group.  A finite group whose order divides a prime ` P ` contains an element of order ` P ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Jan-2015.)
statement:
odcau.x $e |- X = ( Base ` G ) $.
odcau.o $e |- O = ( od ` G ) $.
odcau $p |- ( ( ( G e. Grp /\ X e. Fin /\ P e. Prime ) /\ P || ( # ` X ) ) -> E. g e. X ( O ` g ) = P ) $.
$d G g $.
$d P g $.
$d X g $.
